meanings.definition: To stay awake longer than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She outwatched her friend during the sleepover.
meanings.sent2: He outwatched his brother during the scary movie marathon.
meanings.sent3: The cat outwatched the mouse, waiting patiently for it to make a move.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse outwatched the storm, standing tall and vigilant.
meanings.sent5: The owl outwatched the night, its eyes never closing in search of prey.

meanings.definition: To surpass in vigilance or endurance.
meanings.sent1: The security guard outwatched the intruder, catching them before they could escape.
meanings.sent2: The marathon runner outwatched his competitors, crossing the finish line first.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outwatched the birds, quickly grabbing all the nuts for itself.
meanings.sent4: The old tree outwatched the younger saplings, standing strong through many seasons.
meanings.sent5: The detective outwatched the suspect, noticing every subtle clue in the investigation.
